column5: I am heading up to a lake this week that has an all year lake trout season and was wondering where whould be a good place to start looking for them ? I know in the spring they are shallow and the summer they are deep but this late in the fall I really don't know where to start. The lake is stocked with lake trout and the present population do not spawn , so i'm told (that is why there is no closed season) or maybe they still go through the motions ,I don't know. Thanks
I would look for all the classic lake trout structure, and work it from deep to shallow.  With water temps being ideal for them, they could be anywhere....good luck!
I have found when targeting pike this time of the year in the Muskokas, flat -ining has always nailed the occasional laker.  Big spoons, 1.5 mph

Thanks guys , The weather is calling for calm weather the next couple of days so I think I will look for them on the lowrance and sit on top of them and jig for awhile and then move a bit shallower and flatline if that doesn't produce. I have had good sucess this year with the lake trout jigging thanks to some guys on this board and there reports !
